sense.name: manage or survive without assistance
sense.examples: The children are now old enough to fend for themselves. He's used to fending for himself. We had to fend for ourselves until we were rescued. We have enough clothes to fend against the cold.

sense.name: resist, deflect, or ward off
sense.examples: The town fended off an attack. She spent the entire evening fending off unwanted admirers. Somehow she managed to fend off the awkward questions.
